results.title: The Cancer hunters
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, Andrew Liebman, Robin Brightwell, BBC and WBGH Boston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Cracking the code”.
All forms of cancer are caused by faults in the genes. Our new understanding of what causes these faults is leading to revolutionary forms of treatment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paula S. Apsell, Andrew Liebman, Robin Brightwell, BBC and WBGH Boston

results.title: Designer children
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, Cynthia Page, Larkin McPhee, BBC and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Geneticists can now offer a cure for some of the thousands of inherited diseases. This program explores the difficult personal, moral and ethical issues arising from this situation.

results.title: Accidents of creation
results.creator_credit: Andrew Liebman, Paula S. Apsell, BBC and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Cracking the code”.
DNA, a simple chemical, defines the difference between every living animal and plant on earth. Differences arise from mutations; small changes in DNA working as the engine of evolution.

results.title: Birth, sex and death
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, Tim Haines, BBC and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Cracking the code”.
The cycle of human life is controlled by genes. Could genes also programme our time of death, or do they just prefer the offspring who carry on?

results.title: The DNA connection
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Page, James F. Golway, BBC and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Cracking the code”.
The Human Genome Project shows just how close we are to microbes, pigs and worms, which may be a fascinating and unsettling discovery.

results.title: The Mouse that laid the golden egg
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Page, Paul Gasek, BBC and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Sheep with human genes making drugs, pigs bred for organ transplantation: European and American companies are making such creatures now, but will scientists be allowed to continue to twist nature in this way?

results.title: The Last governor
results.brief_description: This series profile the years 1992-1997 when Chris Patten, the last governor of Hong Kong worked to negotiate the handing over of the sovereignty of Hong Kong from Britain to China. Written and presented by Jonathan Dimbleby.
results.description: This series profile the years 1992-1997 when Chris Patten, the last governor of Hong Kong worked to negotiate the handing over of the sovereignty of Hong Kong from Britain to China. Written and presented by Jonathan Dimbleby.
description_for_label: This series profile the years 1992-1997 when Chris Patten, the last governor of Hong Kong worked to negotiate the handing over of the sovereignty of Hong Kong from Britain to China. Written and presented by Jonathan Dimbleby.

group_works.title: A Democratic time-bomb
group_works.creator_credit: Francis Gerard, BBC, Dimbleby Partners and Totem Productions

results.title: Another balls-aching week
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Last governor”.
The handover approaches and there is no let up on Patten. Word and deeds by China confirm many people’s worst fears. Issues, major and minor, from a resolution to the British passports conflict, to the fate of Government House crockery must be finalised. This last program in the series charts the closing months of British rule in the leadup to the 30th June 1997 when the British flag will be lowered for the last time.

results.title: Loosening the screws
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Last governor”.
China turns on the heat, promising to tear up Patten’s blueprint. Increasing anxieties about Hong Kong’s freedoms after 1997 form a backdrop for the film’s coverage of the 1995 elections to the Legislative Council. They turn out to be a triumph for democracy and for Patten, but they are soon overshadowed by struggles over other major issues like the Bill of Rights, the Court of Final Appeal and a bitter conflict about British passports for Hong Kong citizens.

results.title: Lewis Carroll country
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Last governor”.
The Sino-British talks collapse. In Hong Kong, support for Patten and his democratic reforms is undiminished despite an onslaught from the dissenters. With the help of Baroness Thatcher and other key players, this episode explores Patten’s inheritance; the 1984 Joint Declaration, under which Britain and China agreed terms for the handover of Hong Kong. Patten introduces his Reform Bill to the Legislative Council, the vote is make or break for him.
